intro: Corydalis remota var. pectinata, commonly known as the woolly corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of delicate, spurred flowers in shades of pink to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky habitats. Corydalis remota var. pectinata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and floral display.
